title: Crime Aid
description: Michael and Holly have sex for the first time, and Michael holds a fund-raiser for the office after it is burglarized. Dwight confides in Phyllis after Andy and Angela set a wedding date, and Jim runs into Pam's ex-fiancÃ©, Roy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: New York, as it turns out, is very expensive, and I ran out of money. I thought about selling a kidney, but Michael offered to get me a part-time job at corporate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course, now Michael knows where to reach me 16 to 18 hours a week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Paaam-o-laaaaaa... Miss ya kiddo. Miss you... so much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was really fun last night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm actually thinking about getting my own set of putt-putt golf clubs.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, that would be great. You need that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, uh... [to camera] I let her win.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, when, um, can I see you again?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Um, tonight, I'm free tonight. Is that too eager? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Oh, wait, oh, tonight's no good. [Holly's smile quickly fades] Because I am busy taking you out.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [gasps] Oh, I just remembered, I can't tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow... Oh, wait a second, I can't tonight...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Too many times. It's all good, um, alright, so, good, so, have a nice day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In my opinion, the third date is traditionally the one where... you have sex. Does Holly feel that way? I don't know. I will probably find out tonight. If she starts having sex with me I'll know for sure.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's for you. And, um, oh. I am right in assuming that Dwight is short for D-Money. 'Cause that's what I wrote on your save-the-date.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: J-Money. Or should it be T-Money, for Tuna? Receptionist Money. K-Money.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You're making a knife with a knife?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You want to talk about it?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You know I know. [looks at the camera guys] You know they know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know none of that. If I did, you'd be the last to know.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, the mall could be fun.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We could go to the food court and get different foods. You could get Chicken Teriyaki. I could get a hot dog.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Some of what we order depends on whether we're having sex after. [laughs] Oh, my. Wow, elephant in the room. Are we, do you think? Do you think we're going to have sex tonight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, so, we do the restaurant thing and then... then... then we can do... We'll just do the restaurant thing first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Probably get soup or something light.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She introduced me to so many things. Pasteurized milk, sheets, monotheism, presents on your birthday, preventative medicine.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's nice to learn new things.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Angela's not really a risk taker. And Andy's not really a risk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. Reservations are at 8:00, so we've got like an hour and 45 minutes. [sighs] [goofy voice] I'm a crazy eight, I'm crazy.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [walking out of the building] Oh, I forgot my keys.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, after vous. [walking into the girls bathroom]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I didn't forget my keys, I just didn't want to make out with you in front of the cameras. Do you think they can hear us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not if we turn these dials [getting louder] all the way down. [whispering] Now they can't hear us at all.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, that's correct. I need to cancel checks from 10,001 to 90,000.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, well, they stole my surge protector.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oscar, I'm now going to be prone to surges.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bravo, Watson. Looks like a classic seven-man job. Okay, security tapes were stolen, Motives-financial, or possible, vintage HP computer collectors. Hank down at security had clocked out. And that's all we have.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: That wasn't us, right? I mean... you remembered to lock the doors?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael I think this is our fault.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So much for sex without consequences.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Jim holds up phone] You are such a dork! Shots!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So apparently Pam went out last night, and accidentally called my work phone at 3:00 in the morning.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm on minute six of this message.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, I do not sound like that.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: You can take the girl out of Philly...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The future mother of my children.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're always safe with me. I'm a very good screamer. And one day, we're going to move to Disney's Celebration Village in Florida and leave all of this behind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I would very much like that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know she loves me, Phyllis. I am sure of it. She practically told me so.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Then you need to give her an ultimatum. Tell her she needs to make a choice. You or Andy. If she pick you, great. If not, you can move on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you sure that's going to work?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It did when Bob said I had to stop talking to my sister on the phone so much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, this isn't our floor. Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: How's everyone doing? My door is always open if anyone wants to talk.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't want to talk. I want my laptop back.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Nobody steals from Creed Bratton and gets away with it. The last person to do this disappeared. His name? [whispering] Creed Bratton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're gonna make everything all right. Alright? Conference room, 15 minutes. Half an hour. Alright?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To recoup their losses, I am planning a little charity auction, where people from all over Scranton can come and bid on our goods and services. I'm calling it crime-aid. It's like farm aid, but instead of farms fighting against AIDS, it is us fighting against our own poverty.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I think it's a fun idea.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We could auction off things we do for each other like cleaning or tennis lessons. My sorority did it all the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I'm gonna have to stop you right there. Was this a sorority that you didn't get into a real sorority so you had to kind of form your own?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Okay! Well, come on, let's have an auction. Let's do this. We'll auction off people like in the olden days.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So, in order to recoup the value of items we liked, we have to spend more money on things we don't want. Who would ever come to this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, it could be any number of people. It could be a pedestrian. It could be an old person. It could be a lookie-loo. Or, it could be... a Bruce Springsteen fan - what? Who said that? I did. Why did I say that? Oh, I think you know why I said that. I think it is very apparent. I think it goes without saying. Bear with me. There's a point there. But what is the point? I don't understand what he's saying. It seems a little shady. It seems a little foggy. Well, it's not a little foggy there's actually something going on here-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you need us for any of this?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael scored the big ticket item.  Springsteen tickets! The boss scored the boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I think that's pretty boss.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: He knows how to get things. He got me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen to me close. 'Cause I'm only gonna say this once. You either break off your engagement with that singing buffoon, apologize, and then date me, or you can say good-bye to this. [points below his belt]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think you have me confused with another person.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I said I was only gonna say this once. You have until 6:14 PM. 6:14!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pump it up! Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! [Huey Lewis' Heart of Rock and Roll plays] Pump up the volume. Thank you very much, everybody. Thank you, Mr. Springsteen. [music stops] And welcome to C.R.I.M.E.-A.I.D. [clears throat] Crime Reduces Innocence Makes Everyone Angry I Declare. It is not known how many office robberies occur every second because there is no  Wikipedia entry for office robbery statistics. However, tonight, its victims, are standing together and standing strong in the form of song, cooking lessons, and hugs. Really Phyllis? You're auctioning a hug? Okay, so with no further ado, lights, camera, auction! Take it away Bruce! [Huey Lewis' Heart of Rock and Roll plays]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike gave me a list of his top ten Springsteen songs. Three of them were Huey Lewis and the News. One was Tracy Chapman, Fast Car. And my personal favorite, Short People.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, this is the moment that you have all been waiting for. Our first item up for bids tonight is something that I consider to be very boss indeed. [cheers and applause] It is a Yoga lesson from Holly Flax! Yoga! And I would like to start the bidding off at 300 dollars. [auctioneer voice] 300 dollars do I hear 300 dollars? 300 dollars. Hey, batter batter batter, hey batter, swing batter, 300 dollars, 300 dollars, 300 dollars. Anybody, 300 dollars. 400 dollars. Who wants for 400-[speaking gibberish] Do I see somebody in the back? Is there somebody in the back? Do I see somebody in the back? 400-450 [speaking gibberish] Sold! For 300 dollars to me! [bangs gavel, which squeaks] What the hell is that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's the only gavel I could find.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It squeaks when you bang it, that's what she said. Let's hear it for me! Right? A bargain at any price!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yes, great. Very good, Um, so, Darryl, and the boys in the hood in the warehouse, have graciously donated to, uh, go out for a beer with them right now. You know what, I'm actually going to bid on this. I'm going to start the bidding, because this is something that I have dreamt of-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, you can't do that. It's conflict of interest.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Okay, sold! Have fun, you guys. Well, this next item is sure to spring steam from your ears if you don't win it. It just says "Creed."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Another round, boys? Great. [Jim walks to the bar]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I'm not gonna hit you or anything.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, what's up, guys? How you been?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi, I'm Kevin. And I'll do your taxes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's hear an opening bid, everybody. Who's first? Kevin do your taxes. He's the tax man. Kevin the tax man.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Fine. [throws down microphone, knocks down microphone stand]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, alright. Hey, you know what? I would appreciate it if people would stop storming off the stage.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: [playing blues on a guitar] Me and the blues. It's me and the blues. [Dwight looks at his watch, then at Angela, who looks away from Dwight towards Andy]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are getting there folks. Slow and steady. [David Wallace walks in] Well, well, have we been blessed today. Ladies and gentlemen, Mr. David Wallace! Whoo!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Thank you Michael, thanks, thanks everybody. I'd like to auction off a weekend at my place in Martha's Vineyard. Hey, hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey Phyllis, someone let the air out of your tires. Come quick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep it going. Hey batter batter batter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had to get your attention. This is an emergency. [the air is let out of one of Phyllis' tires]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Why couldn't have you just said it? Why did you actually do it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen, she ignored my ultimatum. Now what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, fine. I've moved on. Now how do I get her back?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well Dwight, I don't think you do. I think you've got your answer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, that's it? That's your advice? I thought you had some kind of big master plan.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, I just think we all deserve to be with someone who wants to be with us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. I get it. You're trying to secure your place as head of the party-planning committee. You're just being selfish. [Phyllis slaps Dwight] And you slap like a girl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did Phyllis do wrong? I'll tell you what Phyllis did wrong. She stuck her nose into my business and tried to help me. [Dwight has an epiphany]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She's, um, she's in New York. She's at an art school.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I'd say she's happy. I mean, she loves her classes. Loves the city. I mean, last night, she was out with her friends, till, like, 8:00 AM.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I thought you were a friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [driving] I am going to see Pam. Because I feel like I should. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: When are you getting to Bruce?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, just a few more items.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right! Here we go. All right, big ticket item. [cheering] All right, in my pocket, I have... two tickets... to Mr. Bruce Springsteen, front... Oh, where are those? Has anyone seen an envelope with Bruce Springsteen front row tickets and backstage passes? Anybody seen something like-lying around?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Do you want us to look for 'em?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I think they were stolen. I think they were stolen and they're gone forever. So... oh, that was the last good item. So, good job, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, Phyllis, nobody... really wants a hug, so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, what the hell is happening?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I need a hug, unless you're gonna give me one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 300, we have 300. 300 going once. 300 going twice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 300 and one penny, 300 and one penny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 500 and one penny. One million dollar!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 1,000 going once, 1,000 going twice. Sold for 1,000 dollar. [applause] Nicely done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [driving, sighs, laughs] No. you know what? No. Because... I'm not that guy. And [laughs] we are not that couple. [turns around]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispering] Hey, that looks good. Listen, about the tickets. It's sort of a gray-kind of a gray area in terms of...whether or not I had them- [Holly covers Michaels mouth]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: The Springsteen tickets seemed too good to be true. But, a lot of Michael seems too good to be true. So far it's all true. But yeah, those tickets, really seemed too good to be true.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [after accidentally seeing Michael and Holly kiss] No, I did not know that Michael was dating Holly.
